intro: Pelargonium vaudricourtii, commonly known as the Vaudricourt's geranium, is a species native to South Africa. It is a small, compact shrub that typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters. The plant features oval, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are pink to purple in color, appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. Pelargonium vaudricourtii is well-suited for rock gardens and containers due to its compact size and ornamental appeal.
